alert.note: Alert for Polk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 23 at 6:22PM CDT until April 23 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Polk County in central Iowa... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 622 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Polk City, or near Johnston, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Ankeny, Polk City, Saylorville Lake, Elkhart and Alleman. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 94 and 100. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
